response.job_title: Business Service Officer at Insurance Commission of Western Australia
response.summary:
I am an experienced laboratory technician with 9 years in the field. My skills in research using laboratory equipment, terminology, technology, techniques, and various Microsoft applications are highly developed.  I am self-motivated and I collaborate with fellow technicians functioning as a highly dependable, approachable, adaptable, accountable, hardworking, organized, and dedicated individual/team-player.  My skills and my reputation have advanced within the industry. My resume and my cover letter can testify to my claims. 

Right from preparing equipment in a laboratory to preparation of paperwork according to regulatory schedules, from performing routine essential laboratory equipment calibrations to verifications, from identification of hazards to alerting those involved, from improving safety initiatives to meeting operational targets or trends have been responsibilities of my career.   I am a trained laboratory technician (Chemical Engineer) specialising in research, conducting analysis and reporting on various projects that include extraction Liquid/Liquid and Solid/Liquid for Total Recoverable Hydrocarbons (TRH) and Total Petroleum Hydrocarbons (TPH) in a laboratory to name a few related laboratory & analytical services.
response.skills: Public Policy, Customer Service, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Ability to calibrate, maintain, and sterilize laboratory equipment, Independence, Analytical skills, Time management, Meticulous attention to detail, Knowledge of statistical data collection methods, •	Laboratory and Analytical Skills , •	Interpersonal and conflict resolution skills, •	Research and problem-solving skills, •	Supervising/coaching/mentoring skills , Matlab, Chemical Engineering, Project Management, Research, AutoCAD, Corrosion Engineering, Sample Preparation

profile_positions.description:
•	Performing and assisting in the preparation, sorting, batching, indexing, referencing, exception handling and scanning of documents, and ensures document images meet Commission standards.
•	Creating new claim records, and processes payments and service provider invoices. 
•	Maintaining service provider account information and liaises with service providers where necessary.
•	Undertaking records management functions and maintains accurate offsite storage and retrieval records. 
•	Providing input to Business Services policies and procedures. Assists in business improvement initiatives and projects.
profile_positions.title: Business Service Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Communicate using different channels such as phone, email, face-to-face and provide correspondence to support customers with land queries.
•	Working collaboratively in a team to find better ways to see Landgate satisfy customer needs.
•	Assist team leaders in any administrative or clerical opportunity that are presented with the goal of learning and helping the team to reach daily KPIs.  
•	Moving and being flexible in different roles during the day according to the needs of the communication channels. 
•	Processing of credit card payments and providing customers with receipt information
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Customer service, coaching and mentoring colleagues on techniques of gathering and harnessing information when testing of environmental, pharmaceutical and food samples. 
•	Conduct, compile, and interpret results of chemical and physical experiments, tests, and analyses for a variety of purposes, including research and development.
•	Establish and maintain productive working relationships with inter-departmental officers, colleagues, and clients in the industry. 
•	Supervise and distribute shared goals among fellow technicians/team members.
•	Preparation of extraction Liquid/Liquid and Solid/Liquid for TPH/TRH, OCOP, PAH and others for testing in the organic laboratory. 
•	Management of laboratory equipment and samples including housekeeping activities.
profile_positions.title: Organic Laboratory Technician

profile_positions.description:
•	Performing inorganic analytical test (Hg, As and Se) for clients in the environmental, food, mining, gas, and oil industries.
•	Ensure the organization comply with quality standards and regulators of each industry.
•	Extraction Liquid/Liquid and Solid/Liquid for Total Recoverable Hydrocarbons (TRH) and Total Petroleum Hydrocarbons (TPH) in the organic’s laboratory.
•	Ensure that laboratory equipment is in appropriate working condition keeping the safety of the laboratory as well as the team.
•	Responsible for all the quarantine samples. Register, sampling, treatment, and disposal.
profile_positions.title: Organic/Inorganic Laboratory Technician

profile_positions.description:
•	Applying different standards such as ASTM-ISO-NACE-IUPAC
•	Performing mechanical test for metallic and non-metallic materials
•	Performing risk and OHS assessments for procedures in different projects
•	Improving safety workplace practices amount the staff and students in relation to OSH standards
•	Researching in different types of corrosion and metallurgical/coatings techniques
•	Preserving laboratory criteria to keep it according to national and international standards
•	Assisting in different projects for diverse companies in Perth associated with the corrosion field

Projects that I have been involved in:
•	Non-metallic test of different materials used in pipelines of the major players in the gas and oil industry in Western Australia. 
•	Simulate environment for different corrosion bacteria present in pipelines of the gas and oil industry. 

Key Accomplishments:
•	Developed and organised records and maintained reports for increased efficiency in a 10%.
•	Supported large research projects, reducing 5% the delivering time of results.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant - Chemical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Kept statistics of all quality indicators that Michelin has in order to meet tyre international standards.
•	Reported monthly summaries of Michelin’s indicators.
•	Delivered presentations for the different departments of Michelin’s indicators every two months.
•	Sampled tyres for different laboratory analysis.
•	Assisted in different internal projects in order to optimize the process of tyres.

Key Accomplishment:
•	Saved 9% on tyre waste costs by working closely with technical standards and procedures to ensure automobile tyres met Michelin quality standards.
•	Coordinated all phases of product development, including formulation, experimentation and documentation saving up to 10% of delivering time of reports.
profile_positions.title: Quality Control - Junior Engineer

school.name: Western Australia Institute of Further Studies

company.name: Insurance Commission of Western Australia
